short_summary: Evaluation of the First Nations and Inuit Policing Facilities Program
description: Public Safety Canada funds the First Nations and Inuit Policing Facilities Program to enhance policing infrastructure in Indigenous communities. An evaluation will be conducted to assess program effectiveness, identify successes and challenges, and provide recommendations for improvement.
full_summary:
# PSIB Mandatory Set-Aside: Evaluation of the First Nations and Inuit Policing Facilities Program

## Overview
The Public Safety Canada is inviting tenders for the evaluation of the First Nations and Inuit Policing Facilities Program (FNIPFP), a mandatory set-aside under the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Businesses (PSIB).

## Requirements
The objective of the evaluation is to assess the achievement of short and medium-term outcomes, successes, and challenges encountered over the evaluation period, as well as the application and inclusion of Gender-Based Analysis Plus (GBA+) considerations in program design and implementation. The evaluation will cover the period from 2018-19 to the current fiscal year.

## Eligibility
The tender is open to Supply Arrangement Holders (SA Holders) under E60ZT-18TSPS who have qualified under Tier 1 and the stated consultant category, security level, region, and level of expertise. A list of eligible SA Holders has been provided in the attached documents.

## Scope of Work
The evaluation will provide the Deputy Minister of Public Safety Canada and senior management with reliable information to support decision-making regarding the FNIPFP. The contractor will conduct an evaluation of the program, including:

* Achievement of short and medium-term outcomes
* Successes and challenges encountered over the evaluation period
* Application and inclusion of GBA+ considerations in program design and implementation
* Relationship between the program and other related federal policy and legislative programs
* Best practices, lessons learned, and potential opportunities to improve performance

## Security Requirements
The resource minimum security level required is Reliability Status, and document safeguarding minimum level required is None.

## Selection Criteria
The selection criteria is based on the highest combined rating of technical merit and price.

## Term of Contract
The term of the contract will be from September 1, 2023, to March 31, 2024.

## Contact Information
For any questions or clarification regarding the tender, please contact Mathieu Lemieux at mathieu.lemieux@ps-sp.gc.ca or (613) 878-6790.
